Job Description - Senior Gameplay Animation Engineer
We are NetEase Games Beta Studio and we are looking for exceptional talent to expand our growing AAA game development team in North America. You will be joining a team of high-performing professionals and close friends, passionate about gaming and driven by technology, on a mission to deliver the best high-fidelity AAA action experiences to our players around the world.

As a Senior Animation Software Engineer, you will be responsible for the implementation of animation frameworks, runtime systems, and tools to support animators, artists, designers and motion capture staff in producing high-quality character animation in our AAA action games.

Do you love to challenge yourself to solve complex animation problems with elegant and expandable solutions? Are you happy to collaborate with a diverse team of experts and empower the production of high-fidelity animation content? Are you excited about raising the quality bar of animation technology and precision in the AAA games industry? Then this opportunity is definitely for you!
Responsibilities
Build animation frameworks, runtime systems, and tools to support the delivery and execution of high-fidelity character animation content
Collaborate with animators, artists, designers and motion capture technicians to understand their game animation requirements, workflow limitations and future vision
Analyze existing animation systems, content workflows, and engine capabilities, understand technological limitations and develop solutions to push the boundaries of what the team can achieve
Solve complex animation problems involving high-precision IK, sliding steps, dynamic scaling, multiple body types and physics-based animation
Optimize the real-time execution of animation solutions while maintaining a high level of quality and character fidelity
Apply cutting-edge technology such as AIGC to improve, automate and optimize the animation pipelines and workflows
Onboard, mentor and support your fellow software engineering teammates
Research and develop novel animation techniques and share your knowledge with partnering game teams and the whole company
Requirements
Minimum 5 years of experience as a software engineer in the games industry with multiple published titles
Minimum 2 years of experience in a dedicated/senior/lead animation engineering position
Excellent C++ knowledge with demonstrated experience
Excellent knowledge of modern video game character animation solutions, systems and tools
Experience developing animation technology such as rigging, IK, physics-based animation, compression, facial animation, and others
Strong knowledge of 3D math, physics, memory management, multi-threading and cross-platform development
Strong knowledge of high-end PC and console game development, deployment, and debugging
Ability to write clear and well-structured code, review and maintain high standards of code quality
Strong communication, proactivity, conflict resolution and collaboration skills
Differentiating Factors
Unreal Engine experience is a major plus
Experience writing content tools and plugins for animation software such as Maya and Motion Builder is a major plus
Degree in Computer Science or Engineering is a plus
Team management and leadership experience is a plus
Passion for action games and related genres (sports, action RPGs, fighting) is a plus
Benefits:
Healthcare Benefits: Medical, vision and dental coverage.
Insurance & Protection: 401(k), long term disability and basic life insurance.
Paid Time Off: Annual leave, parental leave and pregnancy-related medical leave after the completion of one year of employment.
Other Benefits: Meal allowance, transportation allowance, and a holiday gift card.
